title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4228.1 - Time, manner of weighing in
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4228.1 - Time, manner of weighing in

State Regulations

Every jockey must immediately after pulling up ride his
horse to the place of weighing, dismount only after obtaining permission from
the official in charge and present himself to be weighed by the clerk of the
scales; provided that if a jockey be prevented from riding to the place of
weighing by reason of accident or illness by which he or his horse is disabled
he may walk or be carried to the scales. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
4228.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
